pageTitle: Prime Minister’s itinerary for Thursday, October 8, 2020 | Prime Minister of Canada
articleHtml:
Note: All times local

Ottawa, Ontario

Private meetings.

The Prime Minister will speak with the Mayor of Mississauga, Bonnie Crombie.

Closed to media.

11:30 a.m. The Prime Minister will make an announcement with Minister of Public Services and Procurement Anita Anand, Minister of Innovation, Science and Industry Navdeep Bains, and National President of Unifor Jerry Dias. They will be joined virtually from Oakville by the Premier of Ontario Doug Ford, Ontario Minister of Economic Development, Job Creation and Trade Vic Fedeli, President and CEO of Ford Motor Company of Canada, Limited Dean Stoneley, and Ontario Member of Provincial Parliament Stephen Crawford. A media availability will follow.

Ford Connectivity and Innovation Centre
700 Palladium Drive, Kanata

Notes for media:

  • Open coverage
  • Media are asked to arrive no later than 10:45 a.m. and come in through entrance C
  • Journalists can dial in to listen and ask questions.
  • Participant dial-in numbers:
    Local: 613-954-9003
    Toll-free: 1-866-206-0153
    Pass code: 6822783#

2:00 p.m. The Prime Minister will attend Question Period.

7:00 p.m. The Prime Minister will participate in a virtual discussion with food bank staff and volunteers, hosted by Food Banks Canada.

The event will be livestreamed by Food Banks Canada.

Media Appearances

8:10 a.m. An interview with the Prime Minister will air live on ICI Radio-Canada Première Quebec.

8:25 a.m. An interview with the Prime Minister will air live on Cogeco Estrie.
